text:
Aku Darling, 
I hope you remember this nickname that drunk Dishaa gave you. I have so many happy memories with you but most of them are you saying " Yaar mai funny hu, tu jaan mujhke hass nahi rahi hai". Spoiler alert: Maybe you are funny a little bit. Just a little bit. 
P.S. You look hot when you dance ( Le ek acchi chiz boldi, ab zindagi bhar khush reh)
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
The biggest scammer/snake I met in IIT K. Sabse zyaada roke, sabse zyaada marks. -_-
You will always be remembered as a member of our elite gang Civil Shakti. Lol. 
See you in Mumbai Gupta.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Hey ex roomie,
2nd year was lit because of you. It felt like B204 room was the hangout spot of our inevitable gang. Thank you for all the countless laughs we shared and the scam we did xD
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Thank you for cooking all those delicious meals and drinks in Goa <3
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
It's funny that we met for the first time through Kushagra's "fake" treat about some random thing in the first semester. Nice plan by the way. You are truly the most humble man I have met so far as it took me two years to get to know that you had an AIR 10, wtf. 
Amidst all the CATAN game nights, pizza nights, and bulla sessions at GH, our friendship grew stronger. Thank you for always saying that I don't need to lose weight :P 
P.S. One of the best memories with you would be the day we went to the Ballroom dance. Not because you dressed up in formals but because you went out with Gunjan an hour later. Yes, we both discussed it later on and are onto you. (: 
Jokes aside, do stay in touch. 

Love, 
Dishaa
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
I think I can never forget your unique choice of towel in the first year. Never letting you forget that dude.
Thanks for all the fun we had during Udaipur trip, it is unforgettable <3
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Civil ke har gande paper ke baad tu kahi na kahi mil jaati thi, aur humesha hum hass diya karte the apni buri halat par.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
69!
Can you even believe that we used to shout 69 in public when we used to see each other? All because the canteen bill came out to be 69 when we hung out for the first time together, while bunking PE. Lol. 
B204 never felt like a room but a home, because of you. We hung out so much together that I feel like we were practically sisters. I can never forget how you had a big meltdown because the restaurant we were ordering from were out of noodles xD
Don't let your craziness die, and stay in touch because I have so many stories to tell your kids.
P.S. Antaragni scam is still one of my best memories.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: It was always fun to hangout with you and Parshad in Hall 3!
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Saini yaar,
Manali mein toh tussi dil jeet leyaa! <3 Even though Manali was kind of the first time we hung out together, it was so fun. Our friendship clicked together instantly. Teri hi vajah se uss trip par itna maza aaya. Trip toh chordh, tere jaisa itna accha dost bhi mil gaya. By god, tere se baat karne mein alag hi feel aati hai.
Salle ab zindagi se exit mat le lena bas tu <3
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Thank you for helping me finish my collage (for some ART course) in CC while we were CoCo’s.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Dance club mein hangout karke mazza aaya tera saath 8th sem mein :P
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Never forget ki Aakash Gupta ke aagey “Jai.. Jai” vale naare meine start karvaye the xD
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Bhandari,
This memoir is a cheers to many more parties ( like the RM party) in the future! Also, let's promise to shop till we drop in Mumbai <3
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
The best memory I have with you is when you, me and Anshika were "partying" in my room during the final semester. I remember how we called up Jai, and used the speaker to imagine trains. Like Whaaattt? xD. Going to your room felt like going on a treasure hunt, and the reward being snacks that you have to find underneath the mess. Lol. Your room should be put up in the GH hall of fame.
Stay cute and bubbly <3
P.S. The teddy stuffed forcefully over the cupboard is a sight I can never forget.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Cheers to the internship we did together, oh wait, VIRTUALLY.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Should I write Avisha or Abeesha? 
I still remember orientation ke time we felt “toofani” and went outside after dark on your cycle. We got lost. Spoiler alert: We were just outside the Director Bungalow. Oof. The second best memory would be during the first month in college when you opened a can of beer and someone from HEC walked in. Aaah the rebellious memories.
P. S. I can never forget how you acted to moan like different people. That was OG.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: I think we can both never forget that dreadful trek in Goa.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: I hope 50 years from now, the old Sharma still remembers the 20 something Dishaa and the time we spent. The MOS ke course ka rona, baby doll par dance, tequila shot at TA201 party, beer party at my room, study sessions at library, attending classes for merely attendance, placement prep, intern rona, 6th sem ki lab ke baad Hall 2 hangout sessions, Udaipur trip, online flirting (calling you future husband), civil lab ke faltu kaam, Zakhir Khan ka standup at my room, teasing you about your side chicas, drunk Dishaa asking you to get drunk a day before your exam and so much more. Wow a lot of these memories involves getting drunk. Lol. Anyway, all of this is just a trailer to a beautiful movie, which I hope does not end with graduation?
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Anubha ke course ke quiz ke baad ki saari video calls mein bohut mazza aaya tere saath! Civil Shakti forever.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Thank you for the life lessons during Chem101 lab! xD
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
People say that there are some moments in life that can change your life forever, and for me, that moment was when I met you in 3rd sem Antaragni. I never could have imagined that a stupid bet could change my life. Also, since I won, I think you need to pay me up? :D
You are the best guy that I have ever met in my whole life, and you always bring out the best in me. Everything in my life was better when you were there. Be it stupid endsems, placements, binge eating Biryani, online shopping, or the multiple vacations we took together! 
Always stay happy, and no matter what happens between us, I am always one call away :)
P.S. If they ever invent a time machine in future, I would revisit the night I met you.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Civil Engineering would not have been the same without you. So thank you for screwing up your JEE- Advanced :)
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
I remember we "partied" at Gandhi's place, and we got the brilliant idea of going to the theatre to watch some Ayushman Khurana movie. That is all I remember of that day, not even the name of the movie.
Oh wait, I also remember buying a Rs. 500 shot with you which was mostly water. Man, we do take some brilliant decisions, don't we? 
Purdue jaake sane mat hona, we all like the insane you.
Until next time buddy.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
The room allocation in our hostel led to our fight, which eventually made us become close friends. The best part about you is, you get so competitive when playing CATAN that it gets so fun to stop playing the game in the middle. I could always open my heart to you, with even the pettiest thoughts, because I knew you would never judge :P 
Thank you for being lazy enough to stay inside the hall, so that my lazy ass could drop in your room at any moment to chill. 
P.S. I still think you gave me COVID :)
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: I remember that we met in Introduction to Psychology. You asked me a question about my presentation. I lowkey thought you were a senior. Lol
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Hello alumni buddy sibling, 
Even though the buddy calls were few, it was amazing to have met you. I always loved how you used to smile whenever you would see me, even if I was kms apart. (Okay kms is an exaggeration, but you get the point). I think the first time I ever met you was in my room (not what generally happens with people xD). 
Keep cracking your stupid jokes :P
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Thanks for the “fake treat” you gave in first semester at CCD. 
RM mein tere saath bitching karke bohut mazza aaya 8th sem mein!
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Tujhse zyaada sweet bandi mujhe nahi pata <3
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Hey Pence,
I remember I heard about you in 1st semester, and I was like really somebody is named Pence? Your name is extremely unique. 
I joined Udghosh to pass sometime and saw you working hard, and I thought to myself ki yeh banda bohut serious hai iss fest ko leke. Just to be clear, I did not leave it cause of you. Lol
Best of luck and I hope you find something in life that you will dedicate yourself into as much as you did with Udghosh :)
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Guruji! I will never forget your dance performance during Quarantine at Hall 1, nor the day you tried to teach us all dancing. Oof, we failed big time but it was all so fun.
P.S. I think we should have written the GH version of the Big Bhaang story :P
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Hum log Antaragini ke stage par dance nahi kar paaye :(
Let’s do that someday.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
I will always remember you as the coder guy of Civil Engineering, who hated every structural course in the department. Maybe the whole department? :P 
Even though we never officially met, and our friendship was mostly over messenger, it was really fun talking to you and realizing that there are others out there who have no intention of keeping ties with CIvil whatsoever.
Aap toh GS vale bade log hai, ab IIT vale CCD nahi, Bangalore ke Starbucks mein pending treats chahiye mujhe!
P.S. Best of luck, and I hope I get multiple coffees when I meet you someday.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: We met for the first time in the library, when I thought you were a first year. Oopsie. Still sorry for that one. It was fun to bump into you at different parts of the campus, be it Mama Mio, OAT, academic area, or my wing. I will always remember the fun snow ball fight we had in Manali <3
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Dude I am still in awe of that dance move, how did you do it?! (I hope you teach it to me someday)
From making the Ouija Board in my room, to the failed prank on Avani that night, it was one amazing day. Do not forget, the ghost of Ravi was killed by vagina. 
P.S. Thank you for introducing me to all the "adult" life lessons as my roommate in 1st year.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Here is to the "Ram Setu" we built in our first year summers!
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
It is weird that we never met and became virtual friends for that Cognitive Science course. Let's meet in real life in future someday.
Best of luck and thanks for taking that course :P
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
“Oye tujhe skittles chahiye kya?”. This was the first thing you said to me as my roommate. Wise choice of words. I do want skittlezzzz. 
I will never forget “ I had a dream, we were sipping whisky neat..” because that cursed song meant waking up for PE in the morning. How did we even do that? Also, that song is forever your alarm tone for me. It was so much fun hanging out with you, and last semester was best <3 
Thanks for contracting COVID, because we got to hangout so much. Hum sahi mein behne hai kyunki uss chit par same name likha tha hum dono ne. Also, don’t forget to get the best room at Stanford, probably the one with a guest room for when I visit. :D
P.S. Do you remember that we stole “CUNT” from OAT at 1am on a winter night?
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Assignment kar rahi hu
Tu kya kar raha hai?
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Writing this memoir takes me back to 3rd semester when a guy named Shashwat Shukla was super pissed off at me because I did know the Hall President Mr. Rishabh Ramola! :P
I never could have imagined that our friendship will bring us to this point in our life, where you are no longer a friend but a family member. The most genuine laughs that I have shared on campus is with you and Shashwat. Even the dreadful placement season was bearable because of you. And remember our deal - become super famous so that I could go to all the celebrity events :D
I won’t say I miss you because I am not letting you exit my life <3
So in conclusion, thank you for choosing my group in Hydraulics lab because that decision gave me you :)
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: You were the first person I talked to when I came to campus, in the hall office. Weird place right?
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: It was always fun bitching about the course load with you on the mess table.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
You have been the constant of my college life. We have been friends right from the first semester and till now. Thank you for sitting next to me in CC and having a water bottle (I got thirsty and that's how we talked for the first time). I remember it was our psychology midterm the next day, and you were so chill. Lol, I thought you might end up failing or something. Spoiler alert: You ended up with an A.
Remember how we used to study together in the library? It was less of study, and more of coffee and rona but it is still one of my cherished memories.
I owe it to you for pulling me out of the first year darkness <3. I don't know how my life would have been if not for you. You have always been a great friend, and someone who has always believed in me no matter what. You are one of the gems that IIT K has given me, and I would keep this gem with me forever.
P.S. Don't forget ~ " Didi bula mujhe, chotta hai tu"
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
We got introduced through WhatsApp by Ramola. Uss stupid Soft Skills ke course ne kuch develop nahi kiya bas tujhse dosti karvadi. Jo bhi kaho thoda mazza aaya uss course mein :P
Kaafi accha banda hai tu, hopefully kabhi Ramola se milne aayega toh mujhse bhi mulakaat hojayegi <3
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
I think the first time I met you was in Hydraulics lab, and we instantly disliked each other. I remember I used to bitch so much about you to Gandhi. Every Bollywood friendship ever? :P
Haha, I don't know how all that turned into so much love. You have been a true friend along this journey!
When I look back at our time together, I only remember us laughing, irrespective of how life was going. Thank you for all the countless little things you have done for me and teaching me, "Shikaar ke samay, kutiya hagasi". But most importantly, thank you for being stupid enough to change your branch from MSE to CE :)
I will not say good bye, because now you have been promoted to the status of family and you don't get to exit <3
P.S. Weirdly I like your RR. I think it's funny.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: I can never forget babysitting the drunk Shreyash during 2nd year Techkriti. You were literally swimming out of the hostel room. SWIMMING. It was a fun night though.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Mr. Maggu, 
I think the first time I met you was in CCD, first semester. It was Kushagra's party. I don't remember much of that day, only that you were sitting next to me and we were chit chatting about something. Thank you for the multiple Nescafe beverages that we have shared and the random bulla sessions. Also, I am still embarrassed about wishing you on 11th December. Oopsie. 
I am pretty sure you are going to achieve great things in your future, just don't fucking ghost me you asshole.  -_-
P.S. I am sure we will stay in touch otherwise who will tell your wife that she is doomed? xD
Love, 
Dish
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: Placement prep saath mein karne ke liye dhanyavaad. I can't believe we are such good friends who have actually never met in life. Whaaaat? Anyway, let's meet in Mumbai, finally? :P
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
I am glad that we both tested positive for COVID because I got to hang out with you (I think this is the only time someone is thanking COVID). Even though, we only reconnected in the final year of college, our friendship still means a lot to me. All those movie nights, game nights, and bulla sessions are some memories that I will keep with me forever. Especially the last night out and the trip back home!
Don't forget to have a guest room in your apartment at USA because I will surely visit you babe.
P.S. l still remember how nobody watched CAST AWAY :)
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
One of the best memories of my entire life is 4th day of 1st year Antaragni. I can still close my eyes and see the lights, the stage, all the heads of the people while sitting on your shoulders. Thank you for making that happen. It was an unforgettable moment. 
We kind of drifted apart after the 1st semester, but you have and will always be my friend. 
Hope to see you someday in future.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: You are so full of energy and always smiling. Hanging out with you during orientation and bumping into you at library or canteen was super relaxing.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: You are the coolest girl I know in campus. Thank you for making my 1st sem so fun with your presence.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
Sabke meomoir mein sab likhte hai ki stay in touch bla bla, but mai toh agar tujhse touch mein na bhi rehna chahun tab bhi papa mummy aisa hone nahi denge. Lol. Dude, kya jaadu kara hai unpe, they absolutely adore you. 
I think the first time I met you was during orientation when you said "Aap saree mein bohut acchi lag rahi hai". Man, I am never letting you forget that day ever. Thank you for being your goofy self, and making the Udaipur trip as well as my college life so so much better. Also, thanks for teaching me to smoke imaginary cigars for a dramatic effect in the conversation. 
Best of luck for IAS exams, mujhe kya mere toh parents ko yakeen ho chukka ki tu banega IAS. 

Love,
Vo bandi jiske ghar tujhe bohut baar dinner par aana padega future mein
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text:
From TA201 to CE412, the journey has been full of memories, none of any studying though.
I remember how we used to hangout in library because of MOS, hangout in Hall 5 canteen and mess, and the TA201 party. But I think the best memory would be hanging out with you in Delhi when a beggar started demanding money. We both ran, of course. 
I hope you never let your laughter die. It is contagious. 
Love,
Dishaa
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: The best memory I have with you is of 3rd year Antaragini, where I met you and said, “Kuwade tera naam kya hai?”.
author: Dishaa  Rajora

text: I still think that the special kulfi we had in the first semester was the biggest scam played by the kulfi vala on us. Thank you for "fake proposing" me during Antaragni and then setting me up for a bet with Faizan a few days later. Since I won that bet, pay up :)
author: Dishaa  Rajora
